action_items.title: Lock your housing budget and automate savings
action_items.description: Cap total housing costs (mortgage+HOA+insurance) at €1,400–€1,900/month (~28–38% of income). Open a dedicated high‑yield savings account and auto‑transfer €1,000–€1,400 on payday. Build a 3‑month emergency fund first (~€10,000–€15,000) to stay safe and confident.

action_items.title: Boost cash flow: cut fixed costs and add side income
action_items.description: Reduce recurring expenses (mobile, insurance, subscriptions, transport) by €150–€300/month and target +€200–€400/month via overtime/freelance. Direct all gains to the home fund to accelerate your timeline without lifestyle strain.

action_items.title: Credit readiness and documents
action_items.description: Pull SCHUFA, correct errors, keep utilization <30%, avoid new credit. Prepare income proofs (last 3 payslips, 6–12 months bank statements, work contract) so you can move fast when a good apartment appears.

action_items.title: Talk to 2–3 lenders/brokers for pre‑assessment
action_items.description: Get a payment‑based pre‑assessment for €1,400–€2,000/month at 3.5%–4.5% interest with 2%–3% repayment. Ask about 90%–100% financing options, KfW programs, and whether purchase costs can be financed. This clarifies what is feasible sooner.

action_items.title: Targeted market search: Munich and close‑in suburbs
action_items.description: Focus on smaller/older flats and energy‑efficient units in Munich districts like Pasing, Moosach, Neuperlach, Obersendling; and suburbs like Germering, Dachau, Unterhaching, Garching, Puchheim, Freising. Set alerts with price‑per‑sqm targets (€6,000–€8,500). Attend 4–6 viewings to calibrate.

action_items.title: Grow the down payment safely
action_items.description: After the emergency fund, channel €1,200–€1,800/month to your home fund. Keep near‑term funds in high‑yield savings/term deposits to avoid market swings. Aim for at least 10% down plus purchase costs if 100% financing isn’t viable.

action_items.title: Pre‑approval and offer strategy
action_items.description: Once savings and lender feedback align, secure a written pre‑approval. Prepare a clean offer package (SCHUFA, proof of funds, employer letter) to stand out emotionally and financially in Munich’s competitive market.

budget_analysis.timeline_months: 3-5 years (faster if using higher leverage or receiving gifts/bonuses)

quick_wins: Open a dedicated home savings account and set an automatic transfer for the next payday
Pull your free SCHUFA report and fix any issues
Set up Rightmove/Immobilienscout24 alerts for target districts and price-per-sqm caps
next_immediate_steps: Automate €1,000–€1,400/month to a high-yield home fund and start the emergency fund build
Book two lender/broker appointments this week for a payment-based pre-assessment and KfW options
